result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Electronically Filing Notice from PO as Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed, Unable to Forward. gme
and Order to Withdraw. Filed by Atty Krave. hml  Signed by RMW 04-19-17. hml
Statewide              SRN signed 1/8/16 - c: DA & SCSO. eif
CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L Hartung, NONA by def. State requests warrant. Court lifts stay and issues warrant $500.00 purge and IA.
NOH from PO as Return to Sender, Attempted Not Known, Unable to Forward. gme

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  James H Krave   DF:  Jeffrey James Carlson did not appear. Case called at 10:39 a.m. Court notes this matter was set for a PTC. Atty Krave attempted to contact defendant. ADA Kelly requests a bench warrant but has no objection to stayed warrant. Court will issue warrant and stay until 01-08-2016 at 1:00 p.m.  Return on warrant scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Heidi or Casey W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Jeffrey James Carlson appeared from jail via video.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
